Text: Green Mountain now colors the box light green but this product is caffeinated. Wife got Snookered caused she thought Medium roast didn't have caffeine; just cause the box was light green. Don't you get fooled too.  Coffee had a bitter taste had to put MORE French Vanilla creamer in it to make it have a smoother taste. ( that was medium roast)  Going back to Newmans Medium roast Decafe..by Kuerig.
This is our favorite flavor of all of the Keurig choices. Just enough kick but still relatively mild.  Great price too!

I received Green Tea with Lemon. Pickwick Green Tea Original 20 tea bags, 1.50-Ounce Packages (Pack of 6) The title was very misleading as I did not want tea with lemon. The outside of the individual box did not state it was with lemon. However, once I opened the box and took out a tea bag, the packet stated it was green tea with lemon. I doubt that I can return this item since it was sold in a box of 6 and I opened one package when I discovered the problem.

Summary: Odd flavor, Other Mio products taste better.
Text: This Mio flavor, "Blueberry Lemonade" is not the best of the Mio lineup. I would suggest trying other flavors first. It seems like an acidic version of the flavor in blueberry oatmeal flavor packets. The odd flavor makes it hard to quench your thirst and leave you satisfied. Unless you grew up drinking blueberry lemonade you will find it hard to like.

Summary: this thing has a molding issue.
Text:
finished half of one steak, the other half dropped on my desk, so i picked it up, saw those nasty white mold on it. makes me sick.

i've seen other reviews saying it had mold issues, i didn't really take it serious since i lovED it.

now i see the problem, not over due, not under the sun, not in high temperature. white mold.

just found out this today, i usually don't write reviews. but this is really really.. i can't think about it anymore. just..

try not to buy it, or just buy the ones in 7-11 at least u can see it b4 u buy it.
I do like how these taste but there is too much dietary salt. I also found that after eating two, I began to get stomach knots.
I love the Jack Link products, but this a bit on the dry side and not much of a BBQ taste.

Summary: The taste isn't great, but the stats are.
Text: I bought these to have a high fiber, high protein, low carb, low GL-impact snack. They meet those requirements. The taste isn't great, but its not horrible, either, and the price is about half of what I paid for a competing product. I do plan to order more, maybe trying a different flavor. I'd recommend these, but with the caveat that they're edible but not outstanding.

Summary: Overpriced, melted in the mail, being returned
Text: It's the size of a minature Hershey bar, came in a bag so it was flat as a frog run over in the road, only a really LITTLE frog you wouldn't notice anyway unless you have just paid $10 for it!! :P It is being returned, honestly in a store you'd see this and think "I'd pay $1.99 for that..."  Just because it has the name on it, don't fall for it, total rip off.

I bought a 2-pack of the liver flavored Everlasting Treats to see if my husky/g.shepherd puppy would like them. She ate the first one in one sitting. That wasn't very "everlasting" and at nearly $4/ea it was an expensive treat. The 2nd one she took 2 - 3 days to eat, so I decided I would buy more of them as an occasional treat. My next puchase included the treat ball and a couple of other flavors (BBQ and Vanilla Mint). I put a Liver and a Vanilla Mint in the treat ball and she went LOVED the VM. It took effort this time to enjoy it, and she worked on it for over a week until there was nothing left but a disk of the treat in the treat ball (so I removed it, gave it to her, and put a new treat in the ball). The ball definitely helped a lot in slowing down the consumption time of the treat and she enjoys playing with it.

Two paws up!

Summary: Not my kind of chocolate chip cookie
Text:
I would not buy these again.

PROS:
-Packaging: Open/reClose works well.
-Flavor: Chocolate seems good.

CONS:
-Packaging: all cookies stuck together in stacks.
-Flavor: No butter flavor, flour-flavor is noticeable.
-Texture: Chewiness is a bit grainy.

Summary: Kids Love Them, I Prefer Original
Text: My kids absolutely loved these cookies, which have a chocolate filling that is sort of like commercial chocolate frosting. I thought they were good (they are Chips Ahoy, after all!) but I prefer the original Chips Ahoy or Chunky Chips Ahoy. It's a fun and different cookie but for everyday cookies, I think I will stick to the original types.

This cookie is very similar to the Chewy Chips Ahoy except it has added chocolate chips on the outside.  It tastes okay but it's not going to earn raves.  Just like the Megafudge version, the cookies are very small and at 150 calories per serving (which is only a few cookies), it's not worth it. The taste isn't spectacular, cookie kind of dry, although the fudge center tasted good. It's a small package as well (10 oz) and at more than $3, I think I can find a better tasting and more satisfying cookie at my local grocer.

Summary: did not receive bulk package in my order only received single bottle yellow  quanity 2
Text:
Believe it or not, my daughter and I thought that this was hair jell. We received a single tube of the yellow color but no others.

Also still waiting for lavender earrings that was ordered around May 19. Was charged for item and went ahead and ordered another set so that I would not loose the chance of having this item. Absolutely love it. Look of multiple holes but only need to use one ear hole.

Easy food. Open can, drain water from can, take product out, fill with steamed rice. It makes a great, easy lunch. I'm a big fan.
I've just got to figure out how to get them out of the can without tearing the packets...

I had read the reviews and so I ordered the Good Seasons Caesar Dressing.  I was really disappointed that it didn't taste at all like Caesar dressing.  I do remember reading that one person said that he/she didn't think it tasted like Caesar, but with all the good reviews, I took a chance.  I am just as disappinted in all bottled "Caesar" dressings as well as in the many recipe's I've tried.  Wish this had been "the" dressing, but sadly, it wasn't.

I have recently started drinking hot tea again (since my childhood when Grandma made us hot tea with milk & sugar) and have been trying different types and brands of tea to find my favorites.  I can't speak the tea lover's lingo (full-bodied, smoky with hints of arsnic, etc.) but this tea is decent.  I use it mostly to make iced tea but I drink it hot occasionally too.  I have been completely spoiled on Dilmah tea & now any others seem inferior.  Lipton Yellow Label is definitely better than PG Tips! I initially bought PG Tips and could never make a cup of hot tea that did not have a bitter after taste.  I thought it was my brewing technique until I tasted better teas.  I probably won't buy more of this tea since there are so many others out there to try but I plan to use up the rest of what I bought.  If anyone wants some PG Tips let me know & I'll send it to you for the price of shipping!!

This natural sea salt is nice and not too sharp tasting. This fine ground salt is perfect for cooking and for use as a table salt in a regular salt shaker. This is not as fine as a popcorn/nut salt but you could easily put this in a spice grinder to make it even finer for such purposes.

The packaging was excellent and no salt leaked whatsoever.

A++ product!

Will definitely buy again when I run out (in about ten years ha-ha).

This item does exactly what it claims. I just bought a 3-pack though and that matters as you'll read below. After the 1)Fine-grinding (a little messy) 2)Filling the K-Cup (also a little messy) 3)Pressing in the K-Kap and brewing, I have an excellent cup of coffee, and I love that!
Then, after popping off the K-Kap and disposing of the used grinds (Yes, definitely messy), time to set the empty K-cup somewhere to dry till next time.
The reason the price matters is that the only reasonable way to use K-Kaps is to pre-make several at a time...maybe 20 to 25. But that's $40 or $50 for that many K-Kaps. So how long will it take to recoup my money? You can see my motivation is economic, and it would be great purchase if the K-Kaps were cheaper, because time is money and it takes time to use the K-Kaps.

Had this product for about 2 weeks now. Not particularly satisfied as of yet. Like others have stated the problem with leakage is annoying & makes a mess, not to mention a weaker brew. Tried pulling the rubber seal/grommet down to account for an apparent gap between the Keurig coffee maker and the K-cap. This seemed to help a little but not enough to keep me from having to place a dishcloth under my coffee mug to avoid a bigger, longer clean-up. Haven't tried the foil trick yet because I've discovered that trick works very well with the My K-cup device, without having to buy pre-packaged K-cups, use them once, clean them out, let them dry, use the K-cap, adjust the seal, clean the mess...

I'm not sure whether to send the K-caps back or keep troubleshooting until I find a solution. Since placing the foil on the My K-cup filter prior to putting on the plastic lid works as well with my Keurig coffee maker as the pre-packaged K-cups I probably wont have a need for the K-caps.

p.s. I still purchase the pre-packaged K-cups since some of them have outstanding flavor. I just don't discard them in my trash can. *HINT* They recycle nicely after removing the foil & filter.

I used it and not bad at all.  I have to grind the coffee fine and put the lid on My-Kap and push in all the way in order to seal the K-Cup.  Sometimes it came out with coffee grinds residue on the brewed coffee. If you want to save money, and you have time filling the K-Cup with your very own coffee, this is for you. I still used it once in a while.

Could have a little stronger taste. I actually add
French Vanilla creamer to give it a stronger flavor. Smells better while it's brewing than when it's in the cup.

Summary: If it looks good, is it good for the cats?
Text:
My two traditional striped cats eat mostly dry Science Diet cat food with a few NuCat vitamins added. They also get Iams canned chicken, turkey, or beef once a day. Brownie prefers the dry food but will eat some canned food only when the can is freshly opened. Pi likes both. We tried the Petite Cuisine Variety Pack (Yellowfin, Snapper, Tuna & Sole, Tuna & Shrimp) and the Petite Cuisine Variety Pack (Chinese Chicken & Chicken Pot Pie) over the course of sixteen days. Each cat got about one-quarter can each day. I alternated cans of chicken and fish varieties.

At first, the felines were enthusiastic. After a while they tired of the chicken. Pi would only lick up the gravy, while Brownie refused to even look at it. The fish was better received. They like the yellowfin and the tuna & shrimp. The cat vote is for two of the six varieties.

There is, however, a question of mercury in ocean fish. A 1995 study in Japan found that cats that ate tuna had a higher concentration of mercury in their fur than cats that ate dry cat food. The study and its results are discussed in an article that you can find on the web by using the search term "all about tuna fish". I posted a question on the Petite Cuisine web site as to whether they had tested their products for mercury. I have not received an answer. My conclusion is that it may be ok to give the cats fish as an occasional treat but not as a steady diet.

According to the manufacturer's website, this (and many of their other products) contains menadione sodium bisulfite complex.

Menadione is a synthetic precursor for Vitamin K and has been reported to have toxic effects. The use of menadione over the natural alternatives (such as leafy greens and kelp) is only for cost-saving reasons, hence usually only found in cheaper and lower quality animal food. It's surprising that pet food at this high of a price actually contains this substance.

Menadione is banned by the Food & Drug Administration in over-the-counter supplements due to its potential for organ toxicity. It's also banned in Europe for human consumption.

A study in rats showed that exposure to menadione "produced lesions in the kidney, heart, liver and lung." Chiou et al. Toxicology 1997.

Menadione's toxicity seems to be due to its ability to induce oxidative stress in cells.

Do an online search for menadione and you'll find more info from a pet food watchdog trying to stop the inclusion of this substance.

In light of recent episodes of toxic pet food and the questionable behaviors of manufacturers and our regulatory agencies, I would advise you to avoid feeding this to your cats.

I usually give my cats canned food as a treat, so I thought I would give this a try for them.

Like the other reviews the ingredients list was nice, there were a few ingredients I wasn't sure about like carrageenan and menadione sodium bisulfite but they all turned out to be a mineral supplement or a thickening agent.

I opened the chicken pot pie first. Very watery with pea sized chunks of chicken, tiny bits of carrots and what looks like onion in it. It smelled like cat food.

The sesame chicken also smelled like cat food, mind you not like a horrible smell, but if you put that and the actual chicken pot pie or sesame chicken in front of me blindfolded I'd be able to tell which was which just from the smell, it's a cat food smell. Anyway, the sesame chicken had pea sized chicken bits in it along with carrots and rice and a hint of sesame oil aroma to it.

Minion Number Two is my picky eater (no, that's a nickname). He liked the juice and ate a few bits of the meat then went to his regular cat food, even side by side he still didn't eat the treat.

Minion Number One (also a nickname) will eat most natural foods from potatoes, hamburger to whole wheat bread. He too enjoyed the juice a lot, ate a few pieces of the chicken then wandered off. He never came back to finish it.

It gets three stars. Two for the ingredients and one that my cats like the juice. It doesn't get five because one, the price, I can see why it's more (because of the ingredients) but my cats will finish off other cans of cat food that are only half the price which is point two, being two adult male cats with hearty appetites they didn't like it enough to finish it.
Pretty good by the cat's standards, about 50% of them like it and 50% don't (we have rescue foster cats that come and go).

Summary: Very Disappointing! Smells like a plastic garbage bag!
Text: This is terrible. It does not smell or taste good. It comes packed in a small black plastic bag and that is exactly what this stuff smells and tastes like. A horrible waste of Saffron :(

I ordered 24 of these burgers. It was my first time trying Omaha Steaks and I'm rather disappointed. While they do hold their shape well and cook fairly quickly, they do not have much flavor at all. Way too similar to regular supermarket frozen patties. They are a let down for the price. You'd get more texture, flavor, and value from standard ground beef. Definitely not worth $45. I'd give them 2 and a half stars if possible.

[[ASIN:I purchase these probably 1 year ago. I was very disappointed with the quality. I was unable to eat these sardines. They had scales and hard bones along with a tough texture. Sorry product. I'm giving them to the cats.

B000EEWZF0 Crown Prince Natural Skinless & Boneless Sardines in Pure Olive Oil, 3.75-Ounce Cans (Pack of 12)]]

coconut palm sugar blonde comes to you brown it looks like raw sugar...but diabetics can use it or people who have a allergic reaction to cane sugar...i gave 2 bags to relatves ,open one for sugar bowl..i do not like it  but my daughter uses it she likes it...i prefer raw sugar.i have diabetics in my family so i share with them..an 2 who have allergic reaction to cane sugar when they eat it....so it is helpful to them ..my daughter sweetens her herbal teas with it.she uses palm sugar or stevia.

You won't find any MSG, hydrogenated oils, or various things that most people can't pronounce and have no idea what it actually is in these chips. What you WILL find, however, is a very flavorful chip that has enough flavor for eating plain, but not too much flavor for dipping.

While I couldn't really taste a true "olive" flavor, I think that the olives mixed with the garlic salt provides a very subtle flavor that is more robust than plain salted chips. Of course, not having an overpowering flavor is a good thing...

Texture is important with the foods I eat, and these had a nice firm crispness to them. Other various natural tortilla chips I've tried (including "store brand" Whole Foods chips) have an off-texture (not quite crisp, not quite stale) that have prevented me from repeated buys. Not the case with these ones.

Purchased this item thinking that from its from label "Sweet Potato " in large letters on the front of the bag that it was actually Sweet Potato Chips, but to find out after eating and finding the taste to be terrible, that it was just tortilla chips with a dusting of sweet potato dust.

As anybody who grew up on Asian food, I love seaweed snacks. I saw this at Whole Foods and tried it and loved it. The lightly salted taste was perfect. However, this is a bit pricey considering you can get the same thing at an Asian supermarket for half the price. But if you don't live close to an Asian supermarket, this will have to do.
My only complaint about this product is how big the sheets are. It would be better if they cut it into smaller pieces. Every time when I eat this, I get seaweed and salt all over myself.

I bought this product for the home because we have avid soda-flavored candy lovers. Just to be clear, this product is NOT worth the price listed here. The quantity is slim, and as you'll see in my review, the flavor pales in comparison to other brands.

In terms of finding cola hard candy, it's difficult to find it anywhere in the US. You may find haribo soda-flavored gummies, but their taste is usually not as strong as the hard-candy substitutes, and the gelatin ingredient may be unwanted to certain people. This candy is interesting in that it has a very mild fizz in it. That said, the candy is is very rough on the tongue/palette (most likely due to this fizz-additive). Now taste-wise, I've had many cola-flavor candies, and this candy's taste is not as strong as say-- candyland's cola flavored candy.

If you can find a lower price, then have at it, but at the price amazon has this candy listed, it's not worth it. Be it made in Japan or Antarctica, this candy is candy, and should never be so expensive for such a meager amount.

Beautiful pink and reddish color, exotic scent, very floral.  I bought this to make a chinese pickled cucumber dish, but 8 oz. of this product is a LOT of product.  I ground them in my mortar and pestle as per the recipe, but the peppercorn shells stuck in my throat and made me cough.  Next time I will take the time to remove the shells afater grinding.

Summary: A perfect sweet treat, the best lollypops ever!
Text: I was sent a box of these by a friend in Los Angeles and I have fallen in love.  Of course, since I live in North Carolina, there is obviously no See's store here.  My favorite flavor is definitely the Root Beer, but flavors like butterscotch and vanilla are AMAZING. I never thought that anything like this could ever be consider a lollypop by North Carolina standards, but trust me, once you taste one of these, you won't want to switch back.  They have great flavors, melt in your mouth, and stay with you once you're done, and once you have one, you can't stop there.  A great gift to any friend!
A great product and the packaging is fantastic because it measures one serving for less waste. It is also great to sit out in a basket for presentation.

I've been buying raw & unfiltered honey for years, from local market, Trader Joe's, and Whole Food. I seriously doubt this is raw and unfiltered honey. The raw & unfiltered honey I bought elsewhere "ALL" looked whitish and murky. When I used it with coffee, you can see some oil floating to the surface of the coffee. The coffee cup always leaves a oily residue which is not easy to wash even with detergent. I don't get that with this product at all. In fact I don't even need detergent at all. Unfiltered raw honey should have pollen, propolis, wax, and live enzymes rich in nutrient. This honey taste like regular honey except it crytalizes way too easily. I recently took this product to a local farmer and I was told this is definitely not unfiltered raw honey. I also took this honey to a famous honey producer in Delaware and I was told the same thing.

For those who wrote positive reviews for this product, please do some search to see what unfiltered raw honey should look like. Some of you got cheated and you don't even know it. Unfiltered raw honey should look like creamy lard, not dark amber liquid that crystalizes easily. This is what Trader Joe's told me.

Summary: Sounds like Velveeta, tastes like fake apple
Text:
I got a free sample of Apple Cinnamon Belvita from my gym a few months ago but had been avoiding it because I like my weekday breakfast to be less carb-heavy. Plus, the name of this product sounds suspiciously similar to a certain processed cheese substance (didn't anyone catch that in product testing?). At any rate, I was in a pinch this morning so I grabbed my Belvita and ran out the door.

The first thing that hit me as I took a bite was the fake-o apple "natural flavor" this thing is infused with. It falls closer to Jolly Rancher than Jonathan on the apple spectrum. Additionally, it's a little sweet for my tastes. However, I was pleasantly surprised by the texture. I expected something too hard or overly grainy, but it actually is more reminiscent of a Biscoff cookie than anything else. And like Biscoff, it made a decent accompaniment to a cup of coffee.

Because of the fake-o flavor, I didn't expect this to have any actual fruit in it, but little bits of dried apple kept getting stuck in my molars. Surprise. These are more of an annoyance than an asset, though, since I spent about 10 minutes trying to discreetly pick them out of my teeth with my tongue.

Others seem to enjoy Belvita, but it's not really my thing. I have a sample of the blueberry-flavored one I'm going to try as well, but I can't see myself consistently purchasing it.
I like this produce its great stuff and it really works . I would buy it again and again, that is how much I love this

It's hard to say if this product has had any kind of calming affect.

It's not hard to say if this product affects your bathroom experience. It does! Be careful how much you take.

Summary: Good for desserts not great for bread or pizza
Text:
This is a fairly good GF bread mix but it is WAY sweeter than is necessary. We have used this to make bread and pizza crusts so far. The bread is very odd when used for sandwiches made with lunch meat. The sweet bread contrasts the salty meet in not a good way. That being said, its sweetness adds a pleasant element to PB&J. Likewise, with the pizza, the crust was oddly too sweet. I have yet to make rolls or a cake with this dough mix. I believe they would be a much better application for this mix as the bread seems cakey all by itself. The dough is very messy to work worth but par for the course in the GF world. For bread and pizza crusts, I think I will use some of the more expensive and less sweet mixes that are available. I am going with 4 stars as this product does make good but very sweet products.

Now that I've had a few desserts made with this mix I thought I would add an update. So far, I think sugar cookies are the best application for this mix. They have been well enjoyed by all the celiacs and glutenatious people I know. They are slightly cakier than a normal sugar cookie but I don't really find that to be an issue. So for products that are normally sweet any way, this is a good mix. For regular breads and pizza crusts, I still don't love it.

I tried this bread mix for the first time a couple days ago, and followed the directions, faithfully. I did not use a bread machine, but otherwise, followed the optional directions to make it by hand. It turned out to be an extremely heavy brick, uncooked in the middle.  Tried to eat it anyways, but it was so damp and uncooked, had to give up.  Horrible!

I was buying individual packets of these at Whole Foods and I thought I'd check the price at Amazon. I'm really glad I thought to do that...I am now saving 66% over what I was paying before. The only negative is that I have to get 30 of the same flavor, instead of one mangosteen, one dragon fruit, one cranberry-pomegranate, etc. BUT the Acai Berry flavor is pretty good so I don't mind too much.
I actually use this as part of a whole drink I make. This is the recipe:

Vitamin C Bomb

juice of two limes
1 packet of Emergen-C, any flavor
1 heaping teaspoon ascorbic acid (I buy it by the 3# container here on amazon)
2 droppers-full of apricot stevia liquid (it's made by Sweetleaf and also here on amazon)
A splash of Rejuvelac

Put all that in a 24 oz mason jar, add some ice, fill with water and shake it up so the ascorbic acid dissolves.

Oh yeah and also, I went to the Emergen-C website and found you could fill out a form to get a free sample. Probably not going to be doing that forever, but as I write this they will send you a free sample if you're willing to give them your name/address. Woot!
Rich, great tasting dark coffee. Not bitter at all. A good coffee for those that enjoy a dark richer tasting coffee.

I like this blend very well, its the next best thing to my favorite. Dark Magic isn't as strong as the name suggests but compared to Jet Fuel and wake up call this is the strongest.  If money is no object, consider plugging Kona Coffee into Google, then select a seller and order Peaberry Kona. At about $17.00 for 8 oz its the most expensive available.  But I absolutely frigging guarantee it'll be the best, richest and most satisfying cup of coffee you've ever had.

Summary: Cats Ate It But Didn't Go Crazy For It
Text: My title says it all. The cats all like treats, and they ate this bag, but then didn't go crazy for it. So it would depend on the price whether I bought it or not.

These were a terrific buy at a little over a dollar apiece after I spent over 3 dollar apiece in the store, but my dogs got kind of tired of them, so I really space them out. Usually they would last a week or better before I threw out the stubbies. They are puffed so they sound a little cardboardy when they chew on them. But the price with free shipping was very cheap compared to single purchase locally.

Horizon Legacy is high quality dog food that I am willing to pay a premium for.. However, paying a premium for expired food just doesn't seem right.  I ordered the food at the end of November, and the food that was sent expired last September.  Very disappointing.
Good quick rub. If you tenderize your steak with a Jaccard tenderizer or equivalent, spread it (and a bit of EVOO) on the meat BEFORE your tenderize. You won't be disappointed.

The real plus to Lucid is that it's available in almost any liquor store in the USA.  Compared to better absinthes (any of the Jades or Absinthe Duplais by Matter are personal favorites) this one isn't that good.  It IS one of the more drinkable Absinthes, and is a good starter for someone who wants to try this iconic drink.  I usually keep a bottle of this around for Absinthe based cocktails; it's a good value for that purpose.

Summary: Finally the help your dog needs!
Text: I have a lot of hope using this food for my dogs skin allergies and ear infections. This company has the BEST costumer service I've ever had in an online shopping experience. They had their vet talk to me about my dogs problems and help me with other ways I could help het. You need to try this for your dog if you are having constant ear infections and itchy skin. Kirby, my yellow lab, has had these problems her whole life and I just continue to pay vet bills to band aid fix her problems. This food has already reduced the itching and we have only been on it a week. It takes 12 weeks to see the full results and I'm already seeing changes. Please try this if your dog is suffering like mine was...it's a permanent fix to the problem, and I promise this company will help you every way they can to make sure you understand the product and how it works!

Summary: Not peppermint, weak chocolate, not sweet, not creamy
Text:
I have started experimenting with different brands of Peppermint Hot Cocoa and I started with Stephen's Gourmet Candy Cane Hot Cocoa. It was a home run. Very peppermint, very creamy, perfectly sweet, very chocolatey, wouldn't change a thing.

Next I tried Bellagio Peppermint Truffle hot cocoa (this one). What a drastic difference. The first problem is that it tastes more like Mint than Peppermint and even has a slight cooling affect to the mouth like brushing with mint toothpaste -- not something I expect or particularly desire from hot cocoa. I noted that Stephen's Gourmet Candy Cane Hot Cocoa has Peppermint Oil, while this one contains merely "Artificial Flavoring".

The second problem is that this cocoa isn't sweet. It isn't bitter, but it was necessary to add a little sweetener to bring out any flavor, else it was just a bland hot drink with a cooling minty affect. Even then, the mint is more detectable by the cooling affect than by actual flavor.

The third problem is that this hot cocoa isn't creamy. I had to add a little half-and-half to make it creamy. In contrast, Stephen's Gourmet Candy Cane hot cocoa only needed water to produce a very creamy hot cocoa -- probably because it includes Nonfat Dry Milk, while Bellagio Peppermint Truffle hot cocoa (this one) includes non-dairy creamer.

The fourth and probably biggest issue is that this hot cocoa isn't very chocolatey, no where near as chocolatey as Stephen's Gourmet Candy Cane Hot Cocoa, and this is someone who actually prefers milk chocolate to dark/rich chocolate -- i.e., it is even weak by milk chocolate standards.

Two stars for the following: 1) attractive and convenient packaging 2) it doesn't taste bad.

Bellagio Peppermint Truffle Hot Cocoa is Made in the USA. Directions: add 3 tablespoons of mix to 3/4 c. hot water and stir. I also add a little sweetener and milk or cream.
The retail store ritz taste better. The price is affordable but the crackers them selves diddn't taste as fresh as the retail store ones.

Summary: Save Energy and Save your Budget
Text: While The Earthmate bulb is undoubtedly a fine product it may not be the optimal choice for you or your application. Budget Wise, there are less expensive CFL bulbs that will say energy and also save your budget.
I am disappointed. When I first bought this coffee last year it had a nice mild and slightly hearty taste. This past batch is much too mild with no body.

I give these lemon cookies 5 stars because I have no 'reactivity', which is especially important for me. I have problems with the soy lecithin, mono- and diglycerides, and the soy in malted barley flour (in unbleached wheat flour). Not hives, but this soreness/pain in my shoulder and hip that are most apparent. I can have at least 6 or more of these with no problems.

I love the lemon flavor!
They definitely do taste sweet, but not in an over-powering way. The tartness of the lemon is still there. More of an adults cookie than a kid's cookie. Soft, but not chewy, so that is nice

I am not wowwed by the funny "bits" that are in the cookies- a textural thing. I'm not sure what those are; lemon, the nuts??? They look yellow, so probably the lemon. Again, I am happy not to be 'reactive'. I don't each them every day.

And, between the lemon and the gluten =-free, they don't/hopefully won't kick up my recent stomach issue either.
This product has done amazing wonders for my wife's GI system.  I would highly recommend it far and above over the counter products, which we have tried, without success for years.

Summary: Don't know why the word "Calm" is on the canister.
Text:
I drink this every afternoon with two heaping teaspoons in 16 ounces of water. This does not make me either sleepy nor calm. However it is both a good way to hydrate (the stuff tastes good) and get a daily dose of magnesium so I like it and will purchase it again.

I am writing this a month or two later and this, in fact does calm me and it also promotes a good night's sleep. I just ordered my second canister.

I bought this product based on the reviews. I usually drink Twinnings Spiced Chai but I wanted to try something that was more convenient than hot tea. I got it in the mail today and tried it as an "iced tea," not good at all. It didn't mix well and mostly tasted like milky water. So I added a little more with little difference. It's a couple hours later and I'm drinking the hot version as I'm writing this review and I still don't like it. Plus the smell isn't very appealing to me. I had to use 6 tablespoons in order to taste the flavor. I don't know about the other reviewers, but I personally won't be buying this again. Big Train can pull out the station, I'm taking the bus!

This high quality Virgin coconut oil will become the only thing you use in your skillet. NO cholesterol and natural healing properties.

In addition, it is great for hair and body moisturizing. Put one jar in the kitchen and the other in the bath.

I've received 3 shipments of this oil, and have had the same problem every time.  The oil is leaking out of the jar, as if it had melted, then it has congealed on the outside of the jar.  The jars are greasy with hunks of congealed coconut oil on the outside.  I like the oil but this leakage has me concerned.
Although cucumber is one of my fav flavors, this doesn't taste fresh - has a slight chemical taste to me.  Not a fav.

Summary: Exactly what I was looking for
Text:
I've gotten to try similar twists from a well known food retailer that we don't have in the Houston area. Thank goodness I found these online -- they're exactly the same, and what an awesome price!

Very light and crispy -- and a perfect snack at 30 calories each, with no sodium or cholesterol!

Summary: Very good, but cheaper on Ebay.
Text:
Very good, but $24 is too expensive for this product.

The identical product could be had for $18 on Ebay.

If you are a comfort food eater, these mashed potatoes cook up one, two, three and are delicious. You only need to add water and they taste as if you put much more work into them. I appreciate the variety pack and Amazon's subscribe program that offers a discount and the choice of how often you want this product automatically delivered.

Bought this basket as a gift for a family member.  For the price, could not believe how skimpy this basket was when I received it!!!  Too embarrassed to give as a gift so had to spend even more money to add items to it!!  Very disappointed :(
Bought used only problem it was poorly packed with all 3 grow lights broke.  Up and running now with little sprouts.

Terrific all-in-one aeroponic grow unit. Seed kits are pricey, but the company has done the hard work of figuring out which varieties of plants grow well in water and which nutrients each plant type needs. Well designed, easy to maintain, fun to watch and quiet - it deserves 5 stars.

Customer service, though, earns 1 star at best. Emails we sent to support went unanswered; detailed voicemails were unreturned. The only way we (sometimes) received help was to wait on their toll-free line for a CSR. The agents were courteous and tried to do whatever was necessary to remedy the problem.

Unfortunately, follow through was quite discouraging. For example, (1) our address was incorrectly entered for an accessory order. We were not able to get anyone at the company to correct it in time which caused a delivery delay. (2) We were charged twice for the order. It took over 4 weeks and many phone calls to customer service before a credit was issued. Finally, (3) the shipping confirmation email was sent two weeks AFTER the order had arrived late.

When we told an agent of our frustrations, they remarked about the overwhelming response they've received through Amazon. Well, with a product receiving such positive reviews, how did they not expect this sort of response? Their own literature describes the multiple years of product development. They should've spent some of that time on decent customer support.
My maltipoo goes craaaazyyyy whith these treats! she doenst eat a lot, but she'll beg for these! Her teeth are very clean too! Ive purchased these treat 3 times now and I will keep purchasing them!

Unlike the other reviewer, I am pleased with the texture of this product but the taste of the Original or "Natural" flavor is not pleasant. I can't quite describe the taste. It's almost a medicinal flavor. Just at the start. Once you begin chewing the taste mellows.
I bought these cute little lollipops for my daughters birthday candy table, they arrived in time and were very cute. but when the kids open them, they were very nasty. so we tossed them out.
I have eight cats and they all love this food! I like that it's natural with no by-products or fillers. It's made of high quality ingredients.

Our 3 dogs love these. They actually do a little dance before settling down to eat it.
So way only three stars?
Well, there is way too much packaging, and emails to CS at Natro and a letter to the CEO have all gone unanswered.

My JRT used to shed terribly before I found this brand.
I have tried at least 20 different premium dog foods, supplements, & coat treatments throughout her 16 years. No expense was too great. Her coat always looked shiny and healthy, but no amount of brushing (I tried all types of grooming tools, even those wire things to strip a dogs undercoat) would even slow down her shedding. And, she is also a very picky eater, demanding a new brand after about a month. All that shopped with HALO.

--It was AMAZING! After a few weeks her shedding was noticeably decreased! Thinking it was a dream and I had finally gone off the deep end I pushed it out of my mind. I didn't want to jinx it but I washed and vacuumed the car especially well, crossing my fingers that it wouldn't fill up with hair. Sure enough, by the time she finished her first 4 pound bag of Halo Stew she STOPPED shedding altogether! AND, she has been eating this brand for months and still loves it! Another prayer answered!

But overall, I think they're good, and they're really a great way to bring a serving of fruit with you anywhere.

We plan to keep the auotmatic shipment for one more month and see if the condition of the product is better. The product itself is good, but if we find it fresher in the store we won't continue to buy it here.

Summary: not very nice pineapple tasted better without the powder i rekon i could make i better powder with sugar, salt and flavour
Text: i rekon i could make i better powder with sugar, salt and flavours out off the shelf from the local super market. tho item was well packed and turned up at mt door faster than i thought it would. just not my taste
I found out that the savings is not as big as I thought it would be.  I will have to continue to check it out to be sure.

This syrup is very tasty. However, it has a laxative effect on your body. Sugar alcohols, maltitol being one, leaves one gassy and in some cases with diarrhea. One morning I made pancakes for my family. My son had diarrhea, and me and my daughters had very bad gas. I said to myself, it must have been something that we ate. I narrowed it down to the syrup because we all ate it. I looked at the ingredients on it and decided to look up maltitol and it sure enough said that it is a sugar alcohol and can have a laxative effect on the body. So I never used it again. So if anyone experiences discomfort after eating this syrup then know it is the cause.

I was disappointed with my recent purchase of this product. I think Instinct is top quality cat food, and my cat ate previous bags of this food with enthusiasm. In the bag I received in my recent purchase the texture was much different and my cat wouldn't get near it.

If the recipe has changed I sure hope the company realizes they made a mistake and changes back. For now we've switched to Wellness Core.

The strawberry flavor rates a 2-3. The waxy mouthfeel of this chocolate gets a big thumbs down. Their Orange in Milk Chocolate was delicious. I am surprise that the same company puts out both products, they are that different.

Summary: I have the perfect solution to Kitchens of India Desserts!
Text: I used to agree with most who state that Kitchens of India should stay OUT of the dessert kitchen---and keep their feet planted firmly on the savory side. However, I cannot seem to resist both the Yellow Lentil Pudding, as well as the White Pumpkin and Milk variety.  While not perfect on their own, just take a few moments to combine with one magical ingredient and VOILA---divine desserts! The secret? WHIPPED HEAVY CREAM!!! Mix the lentil variety with about one cup of VERY lightly sweetened whipped heavy cream that has also been made with the scrapings of 1/2 of a vanilla bean. Mix the pumpkin variety with about one cup of COMPLETELY unsweetened whipped heavy cream without the vanilla.  And in both cases.....well, it's just very special! Indian in flavor, taste, color and aroma. And THAT certainly hits the spot, for us after a meal of roast lamb or tandori style chicken. Oh yes I almost forgot---I choose to cook these by boiling the bags exclusively--have tried it other ways and I find that it messes with the texture. And I always "pour off" any residual oil (lentil variety) or butter (pumpkin)~~but I don't obssess about it~~this is definitely a once-in-a-while type of selection, so no need to worry about calories!  I encourage you to give this a go!!

Shocked to see so many positive reviews for this product. As another reviewer said the ingredients are: horseradish, turmeric, spirulina. Calling this wasabi is like calling food coloring saffron. And you don't have to have lived in Japan to see that this stuff ain't wasabi. The instructions say "mix powder to form a paste". Well, it does have heat. But what you get is this ugly, pale and chalky paste. You need to use a LOT of powder and very little water to get it to the right consistency. Next time, I'll try getting my hands on REAL wasabi root from the asian grocery store.

Some highlights:
* Not too sweet, just right
* Not too salty either
* Some clusters like would be in granola, but not many
* Doesn't smell like vanilla or blueberry at all

Overall, it has a bland and unremarkable taste. I have tried much better granola in the past with a better nutritional profile.
Actually, it's hard to assess the nutritional profile since the "Nutrition Facts" do not show accurate data. For example, one of the ingredients is Vitamin E, but it's not listed under the nutrition facts. Which makes me think that anything could be there (or not be there).

Also, the smell when I opened the package was anything but appealing. No hints of vanilla or blueberries.

Summary: More of a Tasty Topping vs. a Breakfast Option
Text:
Kind Healthy Grains never calls itself a cereal, which is probably a good thing. While it packs a lot of nutrition to start your day, two factors hold it back from being your new go-to item in the morning. First, the taste is decent, but it works much more as an add-in like granola. When mixed with yogurt or fruit, it does a great job of adding texture while not overpowering the other flavors. Second, when you see for yourself how small each bag is, you realize how expensive of a product this is. So even if you fell in love with the taste, most 99%ers would be hard-pressed to budget a bowl of it each morning. If you're feeding a family of four, you'd be ordering more just about every other day.

Our family was already familiar with the Kind bars and we really like them. They come with most of the nutrition benefits but neither of the drawbacks that I outlined above. We'll be sticking with them instead.

While I consider the term "healthy grains" to be an oxymoron, this is perhaps one of the most healthy cereals being sold.

The "clusters" are fairly small but still reasonable to eat with your fingers dry if you don't wish to eat this like a typical cereal in a bowl with a liquid poured on it.

The sugar to fiber ratio is excellent (1:1).

The grains are "good" grains (no wheat). And while "evaporated cane juice" may not be a "refined sugar" it is still sugar, but in a small enough amount to be reasonable (as a guideline I try to consume at least as much fiber than sugar).

The taste is good. The texture is good.

The "blueberry" is "blueberry puree" and gives just a hint of blueberry flavor.

All in all a decent product, even though I advise against consuming grains. For healthy eaters, these make a nice "change of pace".

Saw Immediate results from this product in increased milk production.  I have been breastfeeding for just over 4 months and I saw a drop in my production, so I decided to look to some herbal teas.  This is a great product but more importantly a great Home Naturals inc.

I'm drinking oolong tea because Dr Oz said it would raise metabolism, the jury is still out.......really how would you know? I have lost weight but that's because I quit drinking coffee which I added too much cream to and started working out a lot more. It does not taste the all that great so I add 3 equals and drink it after it cools.

I was surprised that Elsa, which makes glorious balsamic vinegars, passed off the poor ingredients in this bottle as being worth $18. One whiff and one taste told me this is not the real thing. It contains caramel coloring and wine vinegar, just like $5 balsamic from the supermarket. If Taylor's had agreed to refund the return shipping, I would have been satisfied. After all, it's always a risk to buy online. But I feel that their product is actually deceptive, and Taylor's should have taken responsibility.
Bought a single-pack from my local Whole Foods. Its a little too sour for my taste, although otherwise feels fine. In two minds as to whether I should buy this again.

Summary: Needed to tweak recipe to taste good
Text:
I've tried many flavors of Maxwell House's instant coffee drinks. They all do better with four "well-rounded" teaspoons instead of the flat four teaspoons the instructions suggest is all you should need for 6-8 oz water. i.e. Use 5-6 teaspoons per 6-8 oz water if you want a drink at all worth the time/money. It's a shame the packaging is not more honest with how much mix is really needed for a decent drink in order to fool customers into thinking they're getting more for their money than they really are. I tried one drink following the packaging directions just to make sure since it's a different flavor than what I've had before (6 oz water + 4 tsp mix). The result was a muddy looking pool of peppermint water.. no good mocha taste except what you might expect when you put some water in a dirty coffee cup and pick up the remnants of coffee - that's the only trace of "taste" other than peppermint I picked up.

After adding an extra teaspoon (6 oz water + 5 tsp mix), I had a drink that was acceptable, but still not something I would favor enough to buy this mix over other flavors. The mocha taste is lighter than what you get from other flavored coffee mixes. I prefer stronger. At least I didn't find the mint or sweetness overpowering even with the extra teaspoon of mix.

The best way I found to take this mix is adding in some extra instant coffee granules (6 oz water + 4 tsp this mix + 1 tsp other instant coffee mix + 1/4-1/2 tsp sugar). I added the sugar to counter the extra bitterness added by the regular coffee granules. This combination gave me a much more satisfying, flavorful drink, and I will continue drinking it this way until the powder is gone.

I'm not happy with the fact I have to do so much tweaking on my end to get a good drink out of this. The whole point of these mixes is everything should already be in good proportion with proper instructions given on how much is needed to make it. If you don't mind the extra hassle, get this, otherwise, you might try other flavors that come with a better balance of tastes.
Sweet Mocha with a hint of peppermint. What I like is it has a strong taste of mocha that isn't overpowered by the chocolate or the minty-ness. I love it (great in a milk shake.)
very good for making sweet and sour chicken... simmmered with a little pineapple and boneless chicken and serve over pasta or rice.

I wasted my money....This stuff is nasty!! I tasted it once, and its been sitting on my counter ever since. I wouldn't recommend this product...
My dog loves it... for about 10 minutes at a time, and then he finds something else to chew on. But it is really resilient, considering most toys fall apart so quickly.

Summary: Turns a healthy banana into an unhealthy snack
Text: The quick summary is if you want a banana snack, eat a banana. If you want a portable banana snack that will not bruise, get a banana snack like Trader Joe's 'flattened banana' which is nothing but a flattened banana. These banana chips are labeled as 'unsweetened' which makes you think they are healthy, but they have coconut oil which adds a lot of fat calories of questionable quality. I would suggest pure 100% banana for your banana snack. You don't know anything about the quality of the oil which goes into this product or how damaged the oil gets when it is kept at high heat to prepare these chips. Stick with banana only products without added oil.
These noodles don't really stay whole.  Spelt is wonderful but maybe this is not the best for for it.  Try not to over cook it.

NEVER GOING TO BUY THIS ITEM AGAIN...

Summary: Not The Same as Florida Natural Pressed Apple Juice
Text:
Update:

This is not the same juice as Florida Natural Premium Juice that comes in the 59oz bottle. This juice is from concetrated apple juice. All of the Florida Natural Juices I have bought in the grocery store are fresh pressed from US fruit.

I was disappointed with this product. This juice is okay, but just okay. I gave it 3 stars because of the price and the apples are from South America. If it had apple concentrate from China, I would not buy it. This is not anything like the Florida Natural juice I buy at the grocers.

The Florida Natural juice in the grocers refridgerated section is the only real apple juice, made in the USA from USA growers, left on the market. If you know what apple juice is supposed to taste like, you will appreciate this juice and it's fresh apple taste.

I have gone back to buying from the local supermarket. The fresh Florida Natural is absolutely great. I would not recommend the non-refridgerated juice such as this.
I like this product so much that I have signed up for a monthly shipment.  I think that says a lot.  It is healthy and tasty, at the same time.

This is a tasty bar, but as it contains chocolate it isn't great for all occasions, like a breakfast snack, and to me isn't chocolatey enough to satisfy those type of dessert cravings.
It's still WAY better than other healthy chocolate fruit/nut bars.

Summary: LOVE LOVE LOVE the Almond Cashew with Flax
Text: HATE HATE HATE the gooey mess I was just sent from Amazon.  It looked like it melted then firmed up a bit. It was a brown sticky block. Tasted great but it still looked disgusting.
Tried the Mango Macadamia this time and will not get them again.  Really like the Macadamia Apricot the best of all I've tried thus far.

May 15th, 2012 9:04 am
I bought this product[KIND PLUS, Pomegranate Blueberry Pistachio + Antioxidants Gluten Free] for my grandchildren for a healthy snack at school!
When it came I tried it, it was very tasty, but very very sweet and it had something in it that was so hard to bite, that I thought it would chip my tooth! I told my daughter my concerns, but she said she would try it and let her children try it as well!
They found nothing wrong with it!
It was very tasty as I said, but I can not of good conscience recommend this as a healthy snack! It is extremely sweet and children should be where they can brush their teeth after eating it! Which they would not be able to do at school! I would not want whatever that tiny hard thing I bit on[maybe a hard grain] to chip a child's tooth. The adult should try it first to see if they want their child have this either as a for snack for school or for outside playing!
As I said it was very tasty, but it was hard and just to to sweet! I first gave it 5 stars, but I felt I was not being honest when I am trying to eat as healthy as I can! I will not buy this product for my grandchildren nor for me again! And I love nuts/grains/fruits and all the Antioxidants this product offers, but it is just too sweet and that out weighs any nutritional value you gain! If The maker would not have it so sweet as it is, then I would try it again and then could give it a better review! Not everything that sounds healthy is healthy! We see all the healthy stuff and then think wow this is good for us, but we neglect to notice the larger amounts of fats or salts or sugars that has been added and then it is not as healthy as we thought! It is the fats/ salts/ and sugars that is destroying our bodies from the inside out!
Polar2[Eya-Andrea]

Summary: Taste great, but way overpriced for the size and ingredients.
Text: I must admit I like them, and they are a healthy alternative to a candy bar.  But at about $1.50 each for a very small light bar, they're too expensive for most.  Honey, nuts, and a few pieces of dried fruit shouldn't cost that much.  A competitor may come along hopefully with a better value.

I don't know which was worse, the ginger or the lemon cookie.  All I can say is the texture is really off putting to me.  Gluten-free is challenging and getting the best texture is difficult.  Seems like too much reliance on rice flour (cheaper).  Maybe an increase in another gluten-free flour would help.  I ended up donating them to the local food bank.

This tea is excellent for the body. Very soothing as you drink it and relaxes you instantly. I would recommend this tea to anyone. Drink it with honey, taste great! (Also, I usually drink it when I have a cold or just need to relax from a hard day @ work)!

I love the item but one egg cup was cracked when I opened the box.  It was packed well so I'm sure it's a fluke. I would still use this seller again.  I just wanted a replacement though.  However, when I went to the return area, replacement was not an option.  I hope the seller will replace this for me.  I don't want to go to the trouble and expense of sending it back.  The egg set is adorable and I'm excited to use three of them.  I obviously wish I could use all four since that is what I have paid for.  Accidents happen and I know this isn't the sellers fault.  The egg set and spoons are exactly what I wanted and are very adorable.  Love them.
Purchased this for my son overseas; Planters have high quality producst and I would purchase this again.

Planters has released an impressive product - these snacks are quite delectable and full of protein!

However, buyer beware: Those with peanut allergies should avoid this product. This snack is dangerous for those individuals! While there is some mention on the label that the product contains peanuts, I think that there really should be a more prominent warning about this! Maybe Planters thinks its customers will realize that this product is not intended for those with peanut allergies, but as a company you can never be too careful about keeping your customers safe!

I enjoyed this product, and it earns four out of five stars easily, but I can not recommend it for everybody. Those with peanut allergies should stay clear!

For some reason, some people don't like nori so you're stuck using these often times.  They may be good for non-sushi related dishes, but if you want to make maki you'll want to try it the normal way instead of inside-out.  Ingredients have difficulty sticking to this mame nori, making it really difficult to roll.  I figured the half sheets would be perfect for inside-out maki, as they're a bit short for regular unless it's a one-ingredient roll.  But the flavor is neutral and should please your nori haters.  Eat the seaweed, people.
